clinical_study.brief_title: Validity and Reliability of VO2-max Measurements in Persons With Parkinson's Disease
clinical_study.official_title: Validity and Reliability of VO2-max Measurements in Persons With Parkinson's Disease

brief_summary.textblock: Each participant would complete four test days and each test day is separated by 7-10 days. At each test day the participants would complete a graded maximal exercise test (VO2max-test), a chair rise (Linear encoder) as well as measuring of basic demographic outcomes (weight, fat%,blood pressure etc.). The first test day would further include a motor (MDS-UPDRS III) and cognitive examination (MoCA), a questionnaire about quality of life (PDQ-39) and one about depression (BDI-II). Furthermore, the first test day would include two test of walking performance (6 minutes walk test and Time Up and Go). Two of the test days would be completed while the participants are off their Parkinson disease medication for at least 12 hours, while the other two test days would be completed while on their Parkinson medication. The order of the tests would be randomized. It is hypothesized that the VO2max test would be reliable and valid when participants are on medication, while off-medication would affect the reliability and validity.

primary_outcome.description: The maximal oxygen consumption during and graded exercise test. Used to asses the day to day variation between two test.
Looking at the difference between the actual measure of VO2 at the end of the VO2-max test and the predicted VO2 calculated using a linear regression.
The ratio between VCO2 (L/min) and VO2 (L/min)
Blood lactate level taken from a fingertip one minute after the VO2max has ended.
We would detect the maximal heart rate at the end of the test
Using the Borg scala, we would determine the RPE at the end of the test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Chair rise - maximal power output (W) change
secondary_outcome.description: The maximal power output measured during af chair rise (Linear Encoder). Using the change between two tests to evaluate the reliability
A questionnaire to evaluate the quality of life with scores ranging from 0-100 (higher scores indicating worse quality of life)
To evaluate depression. Scores ranges from 0-63 with higher scores indicating more severe depressive symptoms

secondary_outcome.measure: Movement Disorder Society-sponsored revision of the Unified Parkinson's Disease Rating scale (MDS-UPDRS) III
secondary_outcome.description: A motor examination done by an educated assessor. Scores ranges from 0-132 with higher scores indicating more severe motor disability.
To measure the distance, the participant is able to walk over 6 minutes using a 30 meter track.
Participants have to rise from a chair, walk three meters and go back and sit on the chair again as fast as possible, without running
Participants have to complete different task using the MoCA.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Four times (one at each visit) during af 40 days period
secondary_outcome.description: We would collect information about weight using bioimpedance sensor (TANITA SC220).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Four times (one at each visit) during af 40 days period
secondary_outcome.description: Using a blood pressure monitor to ensure that participants do not have a blood pressure above 160/110 mmHg at test day.
Collecting information from when participants were diagnosed with Parkinson disease to detect disease duration (years)
We want to know what type of medication that they use to ensure that participants fulfill the inclusion criterion

biospec_descr.textblock: A blood lactate test would be completed immediately after the VO2-max test.

study_pop.textblock: The study population is selected from hospitals in Denmark, including Aarhus University Hospital, Lillebælt Hospital and Odense University Hospital. Moreover, the population is also selected from private neurological clinics in Esbjerg, Viborg, Aarhus and Skanderborg. In addition, the study population is recruited via the Danish Parkinson's disease association (including their Facebook website).

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age ≥ 40 year
- Written informed consent
- Diagnosed with idiopathic Parkinson's disease
- Hoehn & Yahr ≤ 3
- Taking dopaminergic medication
- Able to complete a maximal aerobic test on a bicycle
Exclusion Criteria:
- Dementia
- Alcohol abuse
- Pacemaker
- Serious cardiovascular, respiratory, orthopedic or other comorbidities excluding maximal exercise participation.
- Pregnancy
